intro: Sterculia africana var. socotrana, commonly known as Socotra's Sterculia, is a unique plant native to the Socotra archipelago. It is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and distinctive, woody fruits that contain several seeds. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is also notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
